title.narrative: KEWASNET: förbättrad styrning i kenyanska vattensektorn
KEWASNET: improved governance in the Kenyan water sector

description.narrative: The original objectives and outcome areas of the WGSP I remain. The additional funding will deliver additional results under the already existing results framework. Priority will be given to finalisation of the proposal for the WGRP II, including supporting the Results Verification Study as needed (e.g. by facilitating KEWASNET members' consultations with the consultancy team). In addition, during the period, priority will be given to the following core KEWASNET activities; - Engagement with the county government of Taita Taveta to enhance incorporation of water and sanitation in their development policy and plans. - Launch of the 5th CSO water sector performance report. - Holding of consultative forums and thematic working groups for members and partners at national and county level. - Participation in some national forums.

Kenya Water and Sanitation Network (KEWASNET) program Water Sector Governance Support programmet tar avstamp i den konstitutionella rätten till vatten och sanitet i Kenya och avser att stärka deltagande, styrning och ansvarstagande av myndigheter och regeringen på lokal och nationell nivå inom vattensektorn. Insatsen kombinerar en nedifrån och upp ansats med kapacitetsuppbyggnad på lokal nivå för att hålla länsregeringar och vattenbolagen ansvariga, med en nedifrån och upp ansats med fokus på advocacy, fortsatt sektorreform och kunskapsspridning på nationell nivå. I utvalda län kommer dessutom budgetanalyser göras för att kunna rapportera på ett genomlysande sätt vad pengarna inom sektorn används till. Civila samhället inom vattensektorn kommer stärkas. Insatsen kompletterar annat stöd inom vattensektorn till statliga myndigheter rörande tillhandahållande av service på lokal nivå genom WSTF (Water Services Trust Fund) genom sitt rättighets- och deltagande perspektiv på lokal nivå. KEWASNET som nätverk har verkat i flera år och är en erkänd NGO aktör inom vattensektorn, men som autonomt nätverk endast i lite mer än 1 år och institutionella svagheter har identifierats i en utvärdering och den externa finansieringen är begränsad. Programmet löper i 3 år och tyngdvikt under det första året ligger därför på att bygga upp sekretariatet för att KEWASNET ska kunna uppfylla sitt mandat, utöka sin närvaro nationellt och även kunna hantera och attrahera ytterligare medel.

The purpose of the project is to strenghten CSO participation in the WASH sector in Kenya in order to secure better governance and sustainable delivery of water and sanitation services to the poor and underserved.

title.narrative: Decision Amendment KEWASNET Förbättrad Styrning i Kenyanska Vattensektorn

description.narrative: The main implementation period ended December 2018. During the small extension in 2019, a review was undertaken by external consultants. Quote from the Executive Summary of the report "Forward-looking Verification of Results from the KEWASNET Water Governance Support Programme 2014 - 2018", FInnish COnsulting Group (FCG) October 2019: "The consultant concluded that the WGSP I empowered citizens to collectively engage on Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) and Water Resource Management (WRM) governance issues. In addition, WGSP I contributed to building CSOs capacity to facilitate citizen engagement and the government’s capacity to create an enabling environment for citizen engagement. KEWASNET strategically implemented citizen participation activities based on Human Rights Based Approach (HRBA) and has achieved verifiable results and realised some impacts. Improved citizen involvement and engagement saw KEWASNET being included at the national and county level water leadership networks and committees. Under WGSP I, KEWASNET facilitated the formation of county level WASH networks that are hosted by the county governments. These networks include various county level stakeholders, CSOs and county governments. WGSP I contributed towards improved citizen participation in the WASH sector through training on citizen participation held in the counties. Policy influencing was a key component of WGSP I on both national and county levels. This was done by engaging KEWASNET member CSOs and key stakeholders in policy development processes. At the national level, KEWASNET facilitated public participation processes and funded some of the meetings towards finalisation of the Water Act 2016. KEWASNET supported the formulation of the National Water Policy 2012 by facilitating the public participation by CSOs (the Water Policy has not yet been finalised). KEWASNET also supported the development of Kenya Environmental Sanitation and Hygiene Policy in 2016 by facilitating and funding public participation meetings. Towards sector knowledge in key WASH and WRM issues, a number of learning forums and activities were facilitated by KEWASNET. During such forums, gaps in interpretation of the Water Act 2016 by the CSOs and citizens were identified. This led to the development of popular versions of the Water Act for CSOs and citizens in 2018. KEWASNET had made a number of publications in the WASH/IWRM sector including CSOs performance reports which is being used by MoWS to inform its annual report. KEWASNET as an umbrella body for CSOs in water governance has contributed to building a stronger, more responsive and effective WASH sector by creating democratic spaces for rights holders to hold duty bearers accountable. An enabling environment was also created where key issues in the WASH/WRM sector were identified. In addition, KEWASNET has influenced collaboration between WASH/WRM stakeholders including CSOs and government institutions at national and county level."
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
